problem.markdown: >>The nine chips shown above are placed in a sack and then mixed up. Madeline draws one chip from this sack. What is the probability that Madeline draws a chip with an even number? (Answer in decimal form, rounded to the nearest hundredth)<< = .44 [explanation] The total number of things you want divided by the total number of things.
problem.p: The nine chips shown above are placed in a sack and then mixed up. Madeline draws one chip from this sack. What is the probability that Madeline draws a chip with an even number? (Answer in decimal form, rounded to the nearest hundredth)

problem.p: The total number of things you want divided by the total number of things.
